ACT
176
Jurisdiction for conducting probate proceedings
Probate proceedings in the first instance are carried out before the municipal court, that is, before the notary public as a court commissioner.
In the municipal court, probate proceedings are conducted by a single judge or a court advisor.
The court will entrust the notary public with the execution of the probate procedure and deliver the death certificate to him.
When a notary public carries out actions in probate proceedings as a court commissioner, he is authorized, like the judge and judicial advisor of the municipal court, to undertake all actions in the procedure and to make all decisions except for those otherwise prescribed by this Act.
